text: Qazaq Air () is a Kazakh airline, which operates scheduled services from its main hub in Nur-Sultan and focuses on domestic flights. ==History== Qazaq Air was founded in April 2015 by the sovereign wealth fund Samruk-Kazyna. The airline was launched on 6 July 2015. It commenced operations on 27 August 2015 on the Almaty to Nur-Sultan route. Qazaq Air joined IATA, becoming the association's 293rd member. In 2019 Qazaq Air successfully concluded the 2nd IOSA (IATA Operational Safety Audit). Thus, the airline renewed its IOSA registration and IOSA Operator status until November 2021. In 2019, Qazaq Air took delivery of two new aircraft and now operates a fleet of five De Havilland Dash-8-Q400NG (previously known as the Bombardier DCH-8-400) turboprop aircraft with an average age of less than three years. ==Destinations== == Fleet == As of October 2019, the Qazaq Air fleet consists of the following aircraft: {| class="wikitable" style="border- collapse:collapse;text-align:center" |+ Qazaq Air fleet |- !Aircraft !In service !Orders !Passengers !Notes |- ||Bombardier Dash 8 Q400 |5 |1 |78 | |- !Total !5 !1 !colspan="2"| |} In December 2017 Qazaq Air has signed a firm purchase agreement for two new Bombardier Q400 turboprops. ==References== ==External links== *Qazaq Air Official Website *Qazaq Air Fleet Details and History Category:Airlines of Kazakhstan Category:Airlines established in 2015 Category:2015 establishments in Kazakhstan
title: Qazaq Air
